title: Airline slammed after terrifying 'plane hijacking' drill video goes viral

An airline has been forced to release a statement saying videos circulating on social media of a 'hijacking' on one of its flights was actually a drill.

Mexican company Interjet reassured the worried public that the footage, which has gone viral, was staged for staff training.

In the clip, one of the kidnappers yells "there is no time, we will start killing passengers" which left viewers confused and concerned online, after it was retweeted more than 34,000 times.

Angry twitter users questioned why it made its way onto social media in the first place without a detailed explanation.

Interjet issued a statement explaining that the drill was conducted on October 5.

(Image: TheNames_JH /Twitter)

(Image: TheNames_JH /Twitter)

They confirmed it was a staged event to help staff deal with possible terror threats and that it was held at Ciudad del Carmen International Airport - and not in the air.

"Authorities of the three levels of government are coordinated to implement protocols to rescue passengers," they said.

"Therefore, the videos circulating on social networks and where a plane Interjet observed were recorded during the drill."

It is not the first time Interjet have hit the headlines in the last few weeks.

In September the airline suspended pilot Alí Ximen after she proposed bombing Mexico City's central square during last month's independence celebrations.

She wrote on facebook: “A bomb should fall in the zócalo . . . it would help all of us out."

(Image: TheNames_JH /Twitter)

Another Interjet employee, Gabriela García Orozco, commented on her colleague's post, saying: “I support you” - and she was then also suspended.

The pilot later uploaded a video to Facebook apologising for her actions.

“I sincerely regret the comment I made, it was an immature comment,” she said.

(Image: TheNames_JH /Twitter)

"People who are close to me, my family, my friends, know that I am against violence.

"I want to offer a sincere apology to my company, which is a great company, to the president, to Mexico, to all the people I truly offended, from the bottom of my heart, I apologize.”
description: The frightening footage was shared on social media but the company eventually confirmed it was shot to help staff deal with terror attacks
